alert.note: Alert for Erie; Genesee (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 2:43PM EDT until July 29 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN ERIE AND WEST CENTRAL GENESEE COUNTIES... At 243 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Even though the heaviest rain has ended, creeks and streams can continue to rise. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pembroke, Akron, Corfu and East Pembroke. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
